p: A 54 year old woman presented to the West China Hospital, Sichuan University for evaluation of the thyroid nodule and enlarged bilateral cervical lymph nodes detected on ultrasound (US). She denied any symptoms related to the thyroid disease. She had a personal history of invasive ductal carcinoma in the left breast (ER negative, PR negative, GATA3 positive and HER2 positive). She underwent left mastectomy and axillary lymphadenectomy, followed by chemotherapy with epirubicin, cyclophosphamide, dexrazoxane, and trastuzumab. A core needle biopsy of right axillary adenopathy and mass in the left chest wall revealed metastatic breast carcinoma 2 years after surgery.
